update.description:
Opening PR to get feedback. The features and tests should be working. One question I have is about where the code should live. ~~Currently they are all in Shape.hh but should they be in their own file, e.g. GetBoundingBox.hh?~~ Features now live in `GetBoundingBox.hh`

I noticed and fixed a problem with `contact.sdf` when writing the bounding box test. The sphere radius is specified incorrectly so they all defaulted to a value 1.0.

**Update:** This PR is ready for review
update.title: Add Get Bounding Box features

content.raw: I guess my main concern is not so much the change in behavior after rebuild because if you rebuild against a newly released ign-physics, it's not too surprising to have new behavior. Instead my concern is, we fix a bug in a header file implementation and make a release of ign-physics, but users don't get the fix unless they rebuild. ign-gazebo users that install from debs won't get the fix because even though they have a new ign-physics deb, they won't have an ign-gazebo that has been built against the new changes. Maybe the solution is to make a patch release of dependee packages when we make a release of ign-physics where the changes are in headers.
content.html: I guess my main concern is not so much the change in behavior after rebuild because if you rebuild against a newly released ign-physics, it's not too surprising to have new behavior. Instead my concern is, we fix a bug in a header file implementation and make a release of ign-physics, but users don't get the fix unless they rebuild. ign-gazebo users that install from debs won't get the fix because even though they have a new ign-physics deb, they won't have an ign-gazebo that has been built against the new changes. Maybe the solution is to make a patch release of dependee packages when we make a release of ign-physics where the changes are in headers.

content.raw: ok my understanding is that we’ll leave them in the headers for now and no change is needed?
content.html: ok my understanding is that we’ll leave them in the headers for now and no change is needed?

content.raw: I added this to the agenda of the weekly simulation meeting in case we want to discuss this further
content.html: I added this to the agenda of the weekly simulation meeting in case we want to discuss this further

content.raw: I think it's different than a typical ABI breakage (like changing the size of an object), which would break existing debs. Rather, changing template code would change behavior after you rebuild. So I think it is something to keep in mind, but I think it's more a behavior change than a breakage
content.html: I think it's different than a typical ABI breakage (like changing the size of an object), which would break existing debs. Rather, changing template code would change behavior after you rebuild. So I think it is something to keep in mind, but I think it's more a behavior change than a breakage

content.raw: You're right, this would be breaking ABI. This is indeed true for all code that uses templates, but most of the public template code in ign-physics forwards the call to the implementation in the physics plugin. There are some headers, like this one, that do more than that and can potentially change down the road, for example, to fix a bug. So, I guess we just need to keep this in mind when making changes because it doesn't fall under the usual rules for ABI breaking changes.
content.html: You're right, this would be breaking ABI. This is indeed true for all code that uses templates, but most of the public template code in ign-physics forwards the call to the implementation in the physics plugin. There are some headers, like this one, that do more than that and can potentially change down the road, for example, to fix a bug. So, I guess we just need to keep this in mind when making changes because it doesn't fall under the usual rules for ABI breaking changes.

content.raw:
is this not the case with all code that uses templates?

and I think requiring a rebuild would be analogous to breaking ABI, whereas breaking API would cause it to fail to build

I haven't thought about this before
content.html:
is this not the case with all code that uses templates?

and I think requiring a rebuild would be analogous to breaking ABI, whereas breaking API would cause it to fail to build

I haven't thought about this before

content.raw: Found that we can do `result.extend(shape->GetAxisAlignedBoundingBox(_referenceFrame))` to avoid creation of temporaries.
content.html: Found that we can do result.extend(shape->GetAxisAlignedBoundingBox(_referenceFrame)) to avoid creation of temporaries.

content.raw: I just realized that since the `Get[Model|Link]BoundingBox` functions are in headers, any change in the code would require a rebuild of ign-gazebo, so any change that alters the output breaks API. Are we okay with that?
content.html: I just realized that since the Get[Model|Link]BoundingBox functions are in headers, any change in the code would require a rebuild of ign-gazebo, so any change that alters the output breaks API. Are we okay with that?
